s.text: Nehring predicted the issue could unite a block of Internet voters: "It's a galvanizing force that will serve to activate Internet users on a political issue."

"We believe that Internet users are the soccer moms of the 2000 election," said Ron Nehring, director of national campaigns for Americans for Tax Reform, which asked all presidential candidates to sign a declaration opposing any Internet taxes.
A congressional commission is expected to recommend a national policy in April.
